resolution.hypothesis: The reporter has code that should display images using SkiaSharp but nothing appears on screen. Without any details, the most common causes are: incorrect drawing coordinates, missing invalidation/refresh of the canvas view, image loading failures returning null, or v2-to-v3 API migration issues.

proposals.title: Request complete bug report
proposals.description: Ask the reporter to fill in the template with actual code, expected behavior, actual behavior, and ideally a minimal repro project. This is a prerequisite for any investigation.

proposals.title: Check for v2-to-v3 migration issues
proposals.description: If the reporter confirms this worked in v2.88.9, investigate common v3 migration pitfalls like API changes, namespace changes, or rendering pipeline differences.

proposals.title: Provide common image rendering checklist
proposals.description: Share a checklist of common reasons images don't appear: null image from loading, drawing at wrong coordinates, canvas not invalidated, view not sized correctly.

payload.draftBody:
Thanks for opening this issue.

It looks like the bug template still has the placeholder text in the Code, Expected Behavior, and Actual Behavior sections. Without actual code or a description of what's happening, it's hard to investigate further.

Would you be able to update the issue with:
- The code you're using to load and display the images (even a short snippet helps)
- What you expect to see vs. what actually happens

If you have a small repro project, that would be ideal — but even a code snippet and description of the behavior would help narrow this down.
